intro: Siphonia discolor, commonly known as the purple siphonia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a slightly hairy texture. Siphonia discolor is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
